item.title: When did people favor composition over inheritance?
item.description: The phrase “favor composition over inheritance” has become one of those thought-terminating cliches in software design, and I always like to take a deeper look at those to understand where they come from and what ideas we’re missing if we just take the phrase at face value without engaging with the discussion that led to it.

item.title: Why is Zig so Cool?
item.description: I can’t think of any other language in my 45 years long career that surprised more than Zig. I can easily say that Zig is not only a new programming language, but it’s a totally new way to write programs, in my opinion. To say it’s merely a language to replace C or C++, it’s a huge understatement.

item.title: Apple is crossing a Steve Jobs red line
item.description: You can fault Tim Cook for a number of things. Number one on the list, of course, is that he is not Steve Jobs. The nerve of that man!
